link_desc:
- Python needs to be installed on your zabbix server

- Tested with TS3 Server 3.5 and Zabbix 4.0

Installation

1. Copy the python script into the external script folder of your zabbix installation and make it executable.

Default script path: /usr/lib/zabbix/externalscripts

2. Import template into zabbix

3. Create a query user from your TeamSpeak3 Client, you need to be logged in as admin.

Todo so, go to the menu Tools->ServerQuery Login.

4. Change macro for your needs:

Macro Default Value Description
{$TS3IP} - Change to your TeamSpeak 3 server ip
{$TS3PORT} 10011 Default query port
{$TS3PWD} - Change to your query user password
{$TS3SID} 1 Default virtual server id
{$TS3USR} - Change to your query user name


5. Check if query is reachable from your zabbix machine. Maybe you need to open firewall port on TS3 server side.

6. Add zabbix server ip to the 'query_ip_whitelist.txt' of your teamspeak installation (not sure if needed)

How it works

The script opens a query connection to TS3 and issues the command 'serverinfo'. The received data get's converted in to xml-style for easy reading by zabbix 'dependent item'.

Contains

25 Items (22 dependent, 1 external, 1 calculated, 1 simple check)

6 Triggers

4 Graphs

1 Screen

CHANGES

2019-01-28: Extended script to use query user and password, extended macro for query user.
